From the second sentence, we have $y-1=2(x+1)$.
Solving the first equation for $y$, we get $y=3x-4$.
Substituting this into the second equation, we get $3x-4-1=2(x+1)$.
Simplifying, we get $3x-5=2x+2$.
Solving for $x$, we get $x=7$.
Substituting this back into $y=3x-4$, we get $y=3(7)-4=21$.
